summary: This document appears to be a detailed travel and logistics record for a multi-day event or meeting, likely related to victim services or legal proceedings in the Epstein case. It includes attendance lists, contact information for victims and guests, travel arrangements, hotel bookings, and staff assignments, with references to federal agency personnel and reimbursement procedures.

events.title: Travel cancellations due to illness and storm
events.description: A flight was missed due to low-grade fever, and travel was cancelled due to Tropical Storm Erma.

events.title: Multi-day event/meeting commencement
events.description: A scheduled event or meeting involving victims, guests, attorneys, and federal staff begins, with arrivals and hotel check-ins documented.

events.title: Event/meeting continuation and departures
events.description: The event continues with hotel stays and scheduled departures for participants.

events.title: Scheduled flight departure
events.description: A participant is scheduled to fly out on this date.

keyFacts: The document details travel and accommodation logistics for victims, guests, attorneys, and federal staff (ODAG, FBI, NYPD) for an event spanning November 10-14, 2017.
A total mileage and ground transport reimbursement of $5,164.30 is indicated, with participants traveling from multiple states including FL, UT, NY, CA, AZ, NV, and NC.
Travel disruptions occurred, including a missed flight due to low-grade fever and cancellations due to Tropical Storm Erma.
Hotel accommodations, primarily at Residence Inn by Marriott properties in Fort Lauderdale, were booked for multiple participants.
The document includes an exemption certificate for federal employees, indicating government reimbursement for travel and accommodation expenses related to official duties.
